quizzes_to_add.title: California DMV Simulation Test #3
quizzes_to_add.description: Full-length California DMV practice test 2025 with 46 questions. This simulation mimics the real DMV written test online California format. Pass with 83% (38/46 correct) to prepare for your official DMV Class C practice test.

questions.question: What is the legal BAC limit for drivers under 21 in California?
questions.explanation: California has a zero-tolerance policy for drivers under 21. The legal BAC limit is 0.01%.

questions.question: When can you drive in a bike lane?
options: When you need to make a turn
questions.explanation: You may drive in a bike lane when making a turn within 200 feet of the intersection.

questions.question: What should you do if you see a pedestrian with a white cane?
options: Stop and give them the right of way
questions.explanation: A white cane indicates a blind or visually impaired pedestrian. Always stop and yield the right of way.

questions.question: You are approaching a school and see children near the street, you should:
options: Speed up to clear the area quickly
Slow down and proceed with caution
Continue driving at the posted speed limit
questions.explanation: Always slow down and be extra cautious around schools when children are present.

questions.question: What should you do if you are being tailgated?
questions.explanation: If being tailgated, the safest action is to change lanes when possible to let the vehicle pass.

questions.question: When parallel parking, you should park within how many inches of the curb?
questions.explanation: When parallel parking, your vehicle must be within 18 inches of the curb.

questions.question: You must notify the DMV within how many days if you sell your vehicle?
questions.explanation: You must notify the DMV within 5 days of selling or transferring your vehicle to avoid liability.

questions.question: What does a solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line mean?
options: Passing is allowed in both directions
Passing is allowed only on the side with the broken line
No passing allowed in either direction
Passing is allowed only during daylight hours
questions.explanation: You may pass only when the broken yellow line is on your side of the road.

questions.question: When must you yield to a pedestrian in a crosswalk?
options: Only when the pedestrian is on your side of the road
Always, whether or not the crosswalk is marked
questions.explanation: You must always yield to pedestrians in crosswalks, whether marked or unmarked.

questions.question: What should you do if you approach a traffic signal with a flashing yellow light?
options: Slow down and proceed with caution
Speed up to clear the intersection quickly
Stop and wait for the light to change
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: When can you legally use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving?
options: When driving in a school zone
When stopped at a red light
questions.explanation: You may only use a cell phone without hands-free when making an emergency call to law enforcement or emergency services.

questions.question: What should you do if you are involved in a minor collision with a parked car and cannot find the owner?
options: Leave a note with your contact information
Wait by the car until the owner returns
questions.explanation: You must leave a note with your name, address, and contact information securely attached to the vehicle.

questions.question: You must turn on your headlights:
questions.explanation: Headlights must be turned on 30 minutes after sunset until 30 minutes before sunrise.

questions.question: What should you do if your car starts to skid on a wet road?
options: Take your foot off the accelerator
Steer in the opposite direction of the skid
questions.explanation: Take your foot off the accelerator and steer in the direction you want to go.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use your:
questions.explanation: Use low-beam headlights in fog. High beams reflect off fog and reduce visibility.

questions.question: You should use your horn:
options: To alert other drivers of your presence
questions.explanation: Your horn should only be used when necessary to avoid a collision or alert others of danger.

questions.question: If you are approaching a school bus with its red lights flashing and stop arm extended, you must:
options: Slow down and proceed with caution
Stop and wait until the lights stop flashing and the stop arm is withdrawn
Honk to alert the bus driver
questions.explanation: You must stop when a school bus has its red lights flashing and stop arm extended, and remain stopped until they are withdrawn.

questions.question: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curb, your front wheels should be:
options: Turned to the left (toward the street)
Turned to the right (away from the street)
questions.explanation: Turn wheels to the right so if the vehicle rolls, it will go off the road rather than into traffic.

questions.question: You may not park your vehicle:
options: On the side of a freeway in an emergency
Within 500 feet of a fire station
questions.explanation: Red curbs indicate no parking, stopping, or standing at any time.

questions.question: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report (SR1) to the DMV:
options: Only if you or the other driver is injured
If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries
Only if you are at fault
If the collision results in a traffic ticket
questions.explanation: An SR1 report must be filed if there is property damage over $1,000 or any injury or death.

questions.question: If you experience a tire blowout, you should:
options: Hold the steering wheel tightly and keep the vehicle straight
Quickly turn the steering wheel to the side of the road
questions.explanation: Grip the steering wheel firmly, keep the vehicle straight, and gradually slow down.

questions.question: A flashing red traffic light means:
options: Stop and wait for a green light
questions.explanation: A flashing red light is the same as a stop sign - stop, then proceed when safe.

questions.question: At a four-way stop, if two vehicles arrive at the same time, who has the right of way?
options: The vehicle that flashes its lights first
questions.explanation: When two vehicles arrive simultaneously at a four-way stop, the vehicle on the right has the right of way.

questions.question: When driving in the far right lane of a freeway, you:
options: Should expect merging vehicles at on-ramps
Must give the right-of-way to merging traffic
Must drive faster than other traffic
questions.explanation: Be prepared for merging traffic when driving in the right lane near on-ramps.

questions.question: Which of the following increases your chances of having a collision?
options: Continuously changing lanes to pass other vehicles
Adjusting your rearview mirror before you start driving
questions.explanation: Frequent lane changes increase collision risk. Maintain a steady lane position when possible.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about large trucks?
options: They have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles
They take longer to stop than a car traveling at the same speed
They have shorter stopping distances than most passenger vehicles
questions.explanation: Large trucks require much longer stopping distances due to their weight.

questions.question: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:
options: The lane closest to the left curb
Any lane as long as it is safe
The lane in the center of the road
The lane closest to the right curb
questions.explanation: Start left turns from the far left lane on a one-way street.

questions.question: When driving on a multilane street with two-way traffic:
options: You should drive ahead of or behind the other vehicles
It is safest to drive in the lane next to the center line
You should drive in the lane with the least traffic
It is safest to drive in the right lane
questions.explanation: The right lane is generally the safest on multilane streets with two-way traffic.

questions.question: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the:
options: Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken
Yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken
The lines are solid and there is no oncoming traffic
There is no sign prohibiting passing
questions.explanation: You may pass when the broken yellow line is on your side of the road.

questions.question: You are driving on a one-way street. You may turn left onto another one-way street only if:
options: Traffic on the street moves to the right
Traffic on the street moves to the left
questions.explanation: You may turn left from a one-way street onto another one-way street where traffic moves left.

questions.question: You must notify law enforcement and file a Report of Traffic Accident Occurring in California (SR1) with DMV if:
options: You are involved in a collision and there is an injury
You are involved in a collision and there is property damage
Your vehicle breaks down on the side of the road
questions.explanation: File an SR1 if there is any injury, death, or property damage over $1,000.

questions.question: When planning to pass another vehicle, you should:
options: Not assume they will make space for you to return to your lane
Assume they will let you pass if you use your turn signal
Assume they will maintain a constant speed
Assume they will slow down for you
questions.explanation: Never assume other drivers will cooperate. Always ensure you have space to complete the pass safely.

questions.question: You should use your turn signals:
options: When turning into your own driveway
questions.explanation: Always use turn signals for any turning or lane change maneuver to alert other drivers.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a diamond-shaped traffic sign?
options: To provide information about speed limits
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs are warning signs that alert you to potential hazards ahead.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use your:
questions.explanation: Use low-beam headlights in fog. High beams reflect off fog and reduce visibility.

questions.question: When can you drive in a center left turn lane?
questions.explanation: Center left turn lanes are only for making left turns, not for passing or regular driving.

options: Slow down and proceed with caution
Speed up to clear the intersection quickly
Stop and wait for the light to change
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means slow down and proceed with caution.
